rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to identify the literary work.  We'll provide the quote for you.)

clues.text:
(1883)
"Fifteen men on the dead man's chest--yo-ho-ho, and a bottle of rum"

(1952)
"Then the fish came alive, with his death in him, and rose high out of the water..."

(1870s)
"In a flash she remembered the man who had been run down by the train the day she first met Vronsky"

(1300s)
"Turn, Beatrice!
...O turn thy saintly sight on this thy faithful one"

(1818)
"Cursed (although I curse myself) be the hands that formed you!"

rounds.comments: (Alex: Those three letters will come up in each correct response in that order, and there will be consonants and other things around them.)

rounds.text: This bird is known for its size (5 feet tall), its call (carries 2 miles) & its rarity; in 1941 there were only 21 in the wild
